p: Between the end of the second and the beginning of the following century BC, the Greek philosopher Plutarch wrote “The parallel lives”, a series of twin biographies, each of which comparing a Greek and Roman prominent figure as for life events, vices and virtues. Now that our world is facing SARS-CoV-2 pandemics with its relevant country-specific timing and evolution pattern characteristics, we feel like repeating Plutarch’s parallelism experiment by analyzing factors eventually influencing its expression in different and far afield countries and by trying a head-to-head comparison between two main Italian regions.
